localization

Class LightLocalization

  • java.lang.Object
    • localization.LightLocalization

  • public class LightLocalization
extends java.lang.Object
    LightLocaliztion uses one light sensor to detect lines around the robot and ultimately precisely travel to a given coordinate.
    Author:
    Adam Gobran, Ali Shobeiri, Abe Yesgat, Reda El Khili

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LightLocalization(Odometer odometer, SampleProvider colorSensor, float[] colorData, Navigation navigator)
      Constructor for LightLocalization object that allows EV3 Robot to localize about a point (x, y) using a light sensor and basic trigonometry

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void doLocalization(double x, double y)
      Localizes about a point (x, y) by calling subsequent helper functions

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • LightLocalization

        public LightLocalization(Odometer odometer,
                         SampleProvider colorSensor,
                         float[] colorData,
                         Navigation navigator)
        Constructor for LightLocalization object that allows EV3 Robot to localize about a point (x, y) using a light sensor and basic trigonometry
        Parameters:
        odometer - odometer that LightLocalization object will use
        colorSensor - color sensor that LightLocalization object will use
        colorData - colorData array of light sensor values that LightLocalization object will use
        navigator - navigator that LightLocalization object will use to travel and turn

    • Method Detail

      • doLocalization

        public void doLocalization(double x,
                           double y)
        Localizes about a point (x, y) by calling subsequent helper functions
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate relative to x = 0 to localize about
        y - y coordinate relative to y = 0 to localize about
